Html:
I'm working on a 1900x1200 resulotion with 'large' DPI fonts. Rawr handles these badly. Even if I change my font to 'normal' sized, alot of the buttons still overlap/etc .

I searched this section and found a reply stating that its a bug with windows forms which can't be fixed. The post was rather old though and some googling did show some possible solutions.
I wont link them here since I wouldn't want to pretend to know how to fix it, but I was hoping you could have another look at it, as I'm unable to use Rawr effectivly because of this issue.

Greetings

It is possible to 'fix' this, though fix doesn't really accurately describe the solution. Basically, you need to re-layout the UI of the whole app. For a complex app like Rawr, with tons of custom UI work, that's a sizable undertaking. The bottom line is that Windows' 'DPI' setting isn't a dpi setting at all; rather it's scalar on some UI elements like fonts, but not all, and is a seriously flawed design, leaving only the most basic, high profile, and built-in programs to support it.

We strongly suggest that you fix your DPI settings, by going to Display Settings > Advanced > DPI, and setting it to Normal. Not just for using Rawr, but for using anything.
